resources.string: 1. Your joints are made of cartilage, which is 80% water. Long term dehydration can lead to joint pain, as they reduce the joint\'s ability to absorb shock.
2. Water forms saliva and other bodily lubricants that keep your eyes, nose, and mouth from feeling dry. If you\'re struggling with dry lips, try drinking more water!
3. Your blood is more than 90% water, and your blood carries oxygen to the different parts of your body to keep you alive. Lack of water can make blood thicker, leading to higher blood pressure.
4. Your skin relies a lot on water to remain youthful. Dehydration can lead to skin disorders and premature wrinkles.
5. Water can regulate your body temperature, especially when you\'re hot. If you struggle with feeling like you can\'t cool down after being outside, drink more water!
6. Most nutrients you are consuming need to be dissolved by water in order to be accessible and helpful!
